name: angular-formatter
comment:
Formatters for angular.dart, a web framework for Dart. A formatter is a pure function that performs a transformation on input data from an expression.

This library is included as part of angular.dart. It provides all of the core formatters available in Angular. You can extend Angular by writing your own formatters and providing them as part of a custom library.

Formatters are typically used within {{ }} to convert data to human-readable form. They may also be used inside repeaters to transform arrays.

For example:

 {{ _some_expression_ | json }}

or, in a repeater:

 <div ng-repeat="item in items | filter:_predicate_">

class.name: Currency
class.preview: Formats a number as a currency (ie $1,234.56). When no currency symbol is provided, '$' used.

class.name: Date
class.preview: Formats date to a string based on the requested format. See Dart http://api.dartlang.org/docs/releases/latest/intl/DateFormat.html for full formating options.

class.name: Filter
class.preview: Selects a subset of items from the provided dart-core.List and returns it as a new dart-core.List.

class.name: Json
class.preview: Allows you to convert a JavaScript object into JSON string. This formatter is mostly useful for debugging.

class.name: LimitTo
class.preview: Creates a new List or String containing only a prefix/suffix of the elements as specified by the limit parameter.

class.name: Arrayify
class.preview: Given a Map, returns a list of items which have key and value property.

class.name: Stringify
class.preview: Allows you to convert an object to a string.
